regex:
  - find:
  ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) ([0-9,A-F][0-9,A-F]) 
  
  -replace:
  \2\1 \4\3 \8\7\6\5\n


0x08A3D748, 184 proc codes

Segments 0x13, 0x14, 0x15 and 0x16 mimic each other. Each does the same thing, create a (blocking) Procs__Gmap_base_menu child. Difference is in the argument it puts in this child's +0x29 proc body, probably indicating which menu should be prepared.

000B 1600 00000000    LABEL 0x16, Manage Items?
0018 1000 080AE2F5    NewFadeOut.
0014 0000 080AE2B9    Fading out.
0002 0000 080B9811    HBlank stuff. Idk what its CPUSet is trying to achieve. Also deletes
                      all procs with mark set to 8 (all Procs_GmapUnit, and some others.)
0002 0000 080B9F45    Creates blocking child __Gmap_Base_Menu and set its +0x29(b) to 
                      menuoption var.
000E 0000 00000000    Yield.
0002 0000 080B9155    Long function. Recreates world map I guess.
000C 1800 00000000    GOTO 0x18. Redundant, but symmetric; 9/10.
